Designed to develop writing and reading skills and communicative skills in authentic situations. Students are introduced to aspects of Vietnamese culture relating to lesson topics.

courses.title: Intermediate Vietnamese
courses.prereqs: VIETMSE 2A. VIETMSE 2A with a grade of C or better. Placement into VIETMSE 2B is also accepted.
courses.desc: Designed for students to advance their Vietnamese language skills from introductory to intermediate level. Designed to develop writing and reading skills and communicative skills in authentic situations. Students are introduced to aspects of Vietnamese culture relating to lesson topics.

courses.title: Intermediate Vietnamese
courses.prereqs: VIETMSE 2B. VIETMSE 2B with a grade of C or better. Placement into VIETMSE 2C is also accepted.
courses.desc: Designed for students to advance their Vietnamese language skills from introductory to intermediate level. Designed to develop writing and reading skills and communicative skills in authentic situations. Students are introduced to aspects of Vietnamese culture relating to lesson topics.

courses.title: Vietnamese Peer-to-Peer Language Mentor Program
courses.desc: Peer-to-Peer Language Mentor Program in which student mentors work with student mentees to increase the language skills of both participants. One hour weekly meetings. VIETMSE 10A is for language mentors.

courses.title: Vietnamese Peer-to-Peer Language Mentor Program
courses.desc: Peer-to-Peer Language Mentor Program in which student mentors work with student mentees to increase the language skills of both participants. One hour weekly meetings. VIETMSE 10B is for language mentees.

courses.title: Vietnamese Culture
courses.desc: Vietnamese culture and society in modern and historical contexts through the study of literary works, film, and other media. Philosophy and religious practices may also be examined. Course is taught in English.

courses.title: Vietnamese Literature and Culture in Translation
courses.desc: Major works in Vietnamese literature and culture in context.

courses.title: Art History:Theories and Methods
courses.desc: Examines canonical texts and explores current directions in Art History.

courses.title: Film & Media Studies: Theories and Methods
courses.desc: Examines canonical texts and explores current directions in Film and Media Studies.

courses.title: Visual Studies: Theories and Methods
courses.desc: Examines canonical texts and explores current directions in Visual Studies.

courses.title: Getty Consortium Seminar
courses.desc: Special graduate seminar offered at the Getty Research Institute in Los Angeles, involving faculty and graduate students from the five graduate programs in Art History or Visual Studies located in southern California (UCI, UCLA, UCR, UCSB, and USC).

courses.title: Graduate Seminar in Visual Studies
courses.desc: Studies in selected areas of Visual Studies. Topics addressed vary each quarter.

courses.title: Directed Reading
courses.desc: Directed reading on a specific topic agreed upon by student and instructor.

courses.title: Writing Practicum
courses.prereqs: VIS STD 290A and VIS STD 290B and VIS STD 290C
courses.desc: Offered winter quarter each year and taught in a workshop format. Assists students with the preparation and revision of the dissertation prospectus so that they may advance to candidacy.

courses.title: Reading for the Preliminary Examination
courses.desc: Directed reading in preparation for the preliminary examination. Formerly Visual Studies 298.

courses.title: Prospectus Research
courses.desc: Research and writing of the dissertation prospectus.

courses.title: Dissertation Research
courses.desc: Research and writing of the dissertation.

courses.title: The Art of Writing: Poetry
courses.prereqs: Satisfaction of the UC Entry Level Writing requirement.
courses.desc: Beginners' workshop in the writing of poetry, evaluation of student manuscripts, and parallel readings.

courses.title: The Art of Writing: Prose Fiction
courses.prereqs: Satisfaction of the UC Entry Level Writing requirement.
courses.desc: Beginners' workshop in fiction writing, evaluation of student manuscripts, and parallel readings.

courses.title: Intensive Writing
courses.prereqs: Students must have taken the UC Analytical Writing Placement Examination.
courses.desc: Critical reading and analysis conducted through literary, academic, journalistic, and fictional genres with additional instruction in paragraph development and sentence-level mechanics. Students analyze and apply rhetorical principles in a range of writing assignments.

courses.title: Introduction to Writing and Rhetoric
courses.prereqs: Placement via the UC Analytical Writing Placement Examination is required.
courses.desc: Introduction to the principles of rhetoric through readings and writing assignments across a range of genres, including fiction, non-fiction, journalism and academic essays. Rigorous instruction in composition and style, including organization, paragraph development, and sentence-level mechanics.

courses.title: Introduction to Writing and Rhetoric with Lab
courses.prereqs: Students must have taken the UC Analytical Writing Placement Examination and the Academic English Placement Test.
courses.desc: Introduces the principles of rhetoric through readings and writing assignments across a range of genres. Rigorous instruction in composition and style. Designed for students seeking additional English language support.

courses.title: Critical Reading and Rhetoric
courses.prereqs: Satisfaction of the UC Entry Level Writing requirement.
courses.desc: Critical reading and analysis conducted through literary, academic, journalistic, and fictional genres. Students analyze and apply rhetorical principles in a range of writing assignments.

courses.title: Argument and Research
courses.desc: Intensive instruction in research methods, argumentation, and rhetorical invention. Readings selected from current nonfiction and materials located by students from the University library’s holdings, to include databases across a range of disciplines.

courses.title: Intermediate Poetry Writing
courses.desc: Intermediate workshop in the writing of poetry, evaluation of student manuscripts, and parallel readings.

courses.title: Intermediate Fiction Writing
courses.desc: Intermediate workshop in the writing of fiction, evaluation of student manuscripts, and parallel readings.

courses.title: Undergraduate Seminar: Applications in Literary Theory and Criticism for Creative Writing
courses.prereqs: ENGLISH 100 or LIT JRN 100. Satisfactory completion of the lower-division writing requirement.
courses.desc: Substitute for ENGLISH 101 for Creative Writing emphasis students.

courses.title: Short Story Writing
courses.desc: Three-hour workshop in short fiction; discussion of student writing and of relevant literary texts.

courses.title: Poetry Writing
courses.desc: Three-hour advanced poetry writing workshop; discussion of student writing and of relevant literary texts.

courses.title: Novel Writing
courses.desc: Three-hour advanced workshop in fiction writing; discussion of student writing and of relevant literary texts.

courses.title: Advanced Expository Writing
courses.prereqs: Satisfactory completion of the Lower-Division Writing requirement.
courses.desc: Study of rhetoric, disciplinary genres, and modes of knowledge production; practice in writing effective prose. Essays of varying lengths, totaling at least 4,000 words.

courses.title: Writing Internship
courses.prereqs: Satisfactory completion of the lower-division writing requirement.
courses.desc: Internships focused on writing. In consultation with a faculty advisor, students create a course from response essays, research essays, and assessment project data. Internships may include editing and publication projects, supervised teaching and tutoring assignments, community literacy projects.

courses.title: Graduate Writers' Workshop (Fiction)
courses.desc: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

courses.title: Graduate Writers' Workshop (Fiction)
courses.desc: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

courses.title: Graduate Writers' Workshop (Poetry)
courses.desc: Graduate poetry workshop open to students enrolled in the M.F.A. Programs in Writing.

courses.title: Writing in Conference (Fiction)
courses.desc: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

courses.title: Writing in Conference (Fiction)
courses.desc: Graduate fiction workshop open to students enrolled in the MFA program in Writing.

courses.title: Writing in Conference (Poetry)
courses.desc: Graduate poetry workshop open to students enrolled in the M.F.A. Programs in Writing.
